alert.note: Alert for Brown; Eastern Cherry; Keya Paha; Rock (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 04 at 8:38PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT EASTERN CHERRY...WEST CENTRAL ROCK...BROWN...NORTHERN BLAINE...NORTHEASTERN THOMAS AND KEYA PAHA COUNTIES THROUGH 930 PM CDT... At 838 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles south of Keyapaha to near Johnstown to near Elsmere. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Ainsworth, Springview, Long Pine, Johnstown, Purdum, Norden, Elsmere, Wood Lake, Burton, Hofeld Lake, Raven, Bobcat State Wildlife Management Area, Hawley Flats, Willow Lake State Wildlife Management Area, Thomas Creek State Wildlife Management Area, Smith Falls State Park, Koshopah, Pine Glen State Wildlife Refuge, Antelope Peak and Moon Lake. This includes the following highways... Highway 183 between mile markers 194 and 225. Highway 20 between mile markers 203 and 253. Highway 12 between mile markers 3 and 64. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Brown; Eastern Cherry; Keya Paha; Rock
